N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8600.1 - Statement of purpose and applicability

State Regulations
(a) A need exists to coordinate and expedite
the delivery of governmental services to business locating or expanding in New

York State. As part of the effort to meet that need, the Office of Business

Permits has been mandated to provide a master application procedure and a
central preapplication conference program. These two services will provide an
applicant who requires business permits from several State agencies with
interagency coordination of the application process and a single forum for the
exchange of pertinent information. This coordinating program will assist
business in making sound decisions based on comprehensive information. It also
will provide the State with more integrated planning information on potential
economic expansion within its borders. The provisions of this Part apply only
to the involvement of State agencies. In almost every instance, however, the

Federal government and one or more local governmental units will have an
interest as well. The office may encourage the involvement of the appropriate

Federal and local agencies to the maximum extent feasible and practicable. The
procedures in this Part may be coupled with conceptual review, Part 8700 of
this Subtitle, especially when it is desirable to enhance planning for a future
development phase. (b) The permits
of the following agencies are subject to the master application procedure: Adirondack Park Agency; Department of Agriculture and Markets; Division of

Alcoholism and Alcohol Abuse; Alcoholic Beverage Control Division (State Liquor

Authority); Athletic Commission; Banking Department; Department of Commerce; Commission on Cable Television; Education Department; Energy Office; Department
of Environmental Conservation; Office of General Services; Department of

Health; Division of Housing and Community Renewal; Division of Human Rights; Insurance Department; Department of Labor; Department of Law; Office of Mental

Health; Office of Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities; Department
of Motor Vehicles; Office of Parks and Recreation; Department of Public

Services; Racing and Wagering Board; Department of Social Services; Department
of State; Division of Substance Abuse Services; Department of Taxation and

Finance; Thruway Authority; Department of Transportation; Workers' Compensation

Board; Audit and Control; Power Authority; and Military and Naval

Affairs. Notes
